result.execSummary:
This case is being appealed. If the court makes a decision in a case that a party disagrees with, the party may have the right to seek review by a higher court to determine if the trial court's decision was correct. Appeals are most often made after a trial or final decision in a case, but an appeal can also occur before a final decision.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Hearing 11/5/14.
**11/5/2014  hearing scheduled for December 12, 2014.
**12/12/2014  set at zero.

Pay the DNA surcharges, restitution, costs and disbursements.  Court orderd monies taken from prison funds taken from DOC and not to exceed 25%.  Balance to be paid while on Extended Supervision.  Failure to pay amounts in full would result in a civil judgment entered against defendant which is nondischargable in bankruptcy.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: Seek and maintain employment.  Be given job and vocational training.  Obtain GED.
Undergo a mental health evaluation.  Follow through with any treatment recommended.

No contact with Pariss H., Shawn S., Miya R. or Stacy B.
No controlled substances other than those legally prescribed for defendant by a duly licensed physician for his mental or physical needs.  Take as prescribed and only for as long as deemed medically reasonable and necessary.
No alcohol.
No contact with the Popeye's Louisiana Kitchen at 6100 W. Silver Spring Drive, Milwaukee, WI.
No contact with Burger King at 5812 W. Lisbon Ave., Milwaukee, WI.
AODA assessment and treatment.  Urine screens.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Herbert L Anderson

records.addlTxt:
Per Order dated August 22, 2022, Appeal No 2022AP001104-CR, 
IT IS ORDERED that the court grants permission to proceed without payment of the filing fee. This order waives only the filing fees in the Court of Appeals. It is not a determination of indigency for any other purpose. Indigency may be reevaluated if a request is received for waiver of other fees based on indigency.

Per Order dated August 22, 2022, Appeal No 2022AP1104-CR,
IT IS ORDERED that the order of dismissal is reconsidered and this appeal is reinstated.
IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that the deadline for Anderson to either pay the filing fee or petition for a fee waiver is retroactively extended through August 16, 2022, the date of filing. See WIS. STAT. RULE 809.82(2)(a) (2019-20).

Per Order dated August 18, 2022, Appeal No 2022AP1104-CR,
IT IS ORDERED that the appeal is dismissed pursuant to RULE 809.83(2)

records.addlTxt: per order dated May 5, 2016, Appeal 2015AP533CRNM, the petition for review is denied, without costs.

per order dated March 9, 2016 IT IS ORDERED that the motion is denied. The 30-day period in which to file a petition for review may not be enlarged. First Wisconsin National Bank of Madison v. Nicholaou, 87 Wis. 2d 360, 274 N.W.2d 704 (1979); IT IS FURTHER ORDERED the motion itself shall be deemed to be a timely but nonconforming petition for review. However, a statement in support of the petition, conforming to the requirements of Wis. Stat. 809.62(2) and (4), must be filed with the clerk of this court by April 11, 2016. If the statement is not filed by that time, this petition will be summarily dismissed. No further time extensions will be granted. 15AP533CRNM. tf
the amended judgment, Atty. Mark S. Rosen is relieved of further representation of Anderson in this matter. per order dated February 10, 2016 on Appeal 2015AP533CRNM.

records.addlTxt: Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Defendant Herbert L Anderson in court with attorney Victoria M. McCandless.  Defendant Herbert L Anderson in custody.  Deann L. Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Pursuant to negotiations, the State moved to dismiss but read in Count 2.  Court granted State's motion and ordered Count 2 dismissed but read in.

AS TO COUNTS 1 AND 3:
Plea hearing proceeds. Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant sworn, examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.  The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms or body armor.   Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.  Parties request a separate date for sentencing.  Court ordered case continued before Branch 20.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 17, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Victoria M. McCandless in court, defendant Herbert L Anderson not in court, in custody.  Deann L. Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant's revocation hearing was adjourned; defense counsel requested another date.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 28, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Victoria M McCandless in court, defendant Herbert L Anderson not in court, in custody.  Deann L Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 20.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 25, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Herbert L Anderson in court with attorney Victoria M McCandless.  Defendant Herbert L Anderson in custody. Step Nolten for Deann L Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state: MPD Officer Ross Muller.    Court took judical notice of certified documents regarding case #05CF955 that are attached to the complaint.State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 20.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 13, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Pariss W., Shawn S., Joshua A., Cameron H., Tyrone C., Karlisha W., Kreshawnna C., Montasir M., Burger King, Popeye's Chicken, Ravon G., Stacy B., Miya R., Mikayla J., Thomas S., Bruce D., Ora R., Dineka R., and Latasha B.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Herbert L Anderson in court with attorney Victoria M McCandless.  Defendant Herbert L Anderson in custody.  Carole R Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings. DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 22, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
